Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Harpocrates wearing headdress with hair in side knot. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white (gypsum?) coating. Dark brown Nile silt fabric. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably made in Naukratis.Parallels of Harpocrates figures of the 1st and 2nd centuries AD (Fjeldhagen 1995, no.20; Besques 1992, Pl.67.e, no.E364, from Antinoopolis?), suggest a Roman date, though there is also a similar unprovenanced piece dated to the late 2nd century BC (Fischer 1994, Pl.59, No.582). Besques, S. 1992. ‘Catalogue raisonné des figurines et reliefs en terre-cuite grecs, étrusques et romains, 4, 2. Epoques hellénistique et romaine. Cyrénaïque, Egypte ptolémaïque et romaine, Afrique du Nord et Proche-Orient’. Paris. Fischer, J. 1994. ‘Griechisch-römische Terrakotten aus Ägypten. Die Sammlungen Sieglin und Schreiber. Dresden, Leipzig, Stuttgart, Tübingen’. Tübingen: Wasmuth. Fjeldhagen, M.1995. ‘Catalogue. Graeco-Roman Terracottas from Egypt. Ny Carlsberg Glyptotek’. Copenhagen.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.113) (Phase 1)
